intro: Streptocarpus huamboensis, commonly known as the Huambo streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forest habitats.
